preqs: 12 credit points at second year level in Art history and theory, or Theory of Art and Design, Visual Culture or permission from Unit Coordinator.

rules.ruleString: Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {AHT%, CLS%, TAD%, VSA%}
Incompatible with (I/W) {CLS2440, CLS3440, TAD2440, VSA2440, VSA3440}
Incompatible with (I/W) {CLS2440, CLS3440, TAD2440, VSA2440, VSA3440}
Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {AHT%, CLS%, TAD%, VSA%}

description: The unit traces the history of international and Australian photography from the medium's invention to the 21st century. The unit will investigate the concept of analogue reproduction, especially photography's promise to represent the 'real' world, and consider practices in which the real is consistently manipulated. Photography will be considered across a range of disciplines: art, ethnographic and anthropological photographs; documentary photography; and the use of photography by the legal and medical system. Finally, the unit will address the changes in the production and circulation of images evident in digital modes of reproduction.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
